intro: Thapsia apulia, commonly known as the Apulian thapsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Italy. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. Thapsia apulia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands.
